definitions.definition: To hurry; to perform a task with great haste.
definitions.example: rush one's dinner;   rush off an email response

definitions.definition: To flow or move forward rapidly or noisily.
definitions.example: armies rush to battle;   waters rush down a precipice.

definitions.definition: (contact sports) To run directly at another player in order to block or disrupt play.
To cause to move or act with unusual haste.
definitions.example: Don't rush your client or he may withdraw.

definitions.definition: To make a swift or sudden attack.
To attack (an opponent) with a large swarm of units.
(college) To attempt to join a fraternity or sorority; to undergo hazing or initiation in order to join a fraternity or sorority.

definitions.example: The shuttle rushes passengers from the station to the airport.

definitions.definition: To roquet an object ball to a particular location on the lawn.
To recite (a lesson) or pass (an examination) without an error.

definitions.example: I was so rushed today, I didn't have time to eat lunch.
My rushed attempt at an essay received a predictably poor grade.
